result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mary Elaine Provost was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Mary Elaine Provost was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $350.00 plus costs by end of probation as ordered in count 3.
Huber release to the Day Reporting Center (DRC). Good Time allowed.

miscConds.notes: Pay stipulated amount of $740.22 to victim, Dennis M.

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 3: Pay costs, and disbursements including the DNA surcharge by the end of probationary period. Should defendant get revoked and be sent to prison, Court ordered monies taken by the DOC's from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance would be then paid while on ES.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Undergo a Mental Health Evaluation; follow through with any treatment recommended.
- No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly license physician for her mental or physical needs; take as prescribed and only for as long as deemed medically reasonable and necessary.
- No alcohol
- AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
- Urine screens to ensure compliance.
- No Contact with Dennis M. or his family.
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Be given job and vocational training.
- Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
- Parenting classes.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is DENIED because it is not in the public interest. Copy forwarded to the defendant. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

on count 3.  Defendant's address:  Mary Provost  #222461, REECC, 21425-A Spring Street, Union Grove, WI  53182.

Defendant Mary Elaine Provost in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  
Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing.  Defense request adjournment; state objects due to victim being present.  Defense contends that formal offer was not in discovery materials turned over from prior counsel.  Defense needs to review offered conveyed recently with the defendant.  The Court grants adjournment; date selected before Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mary Elaine Provost in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Danielle Shelton has assumed Attorney Kastenson's cases; Branch 20 in trial with ADA Schoepp.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mary Elaine Provost in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary Elaine Provost in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties requested another scheduling date; defendant eligible for in-patient treatment.  Court granted joint request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary Elaine Provost in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Ron Dague for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP

Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-23-2015 at 08:30 am.
